attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It seems rediculous in this 'green and pleasant land' that we import milk.

Where are the price controls that will help keep our dairy farmers in business?

It has been suggested that it is more cost effective for cattle to be kept in barns all year . . .

Think of your grandchildren - they are round that corner, and their children . . .

Historically we have been a nation of farmers. Will this disappear like our manufacturers?

Somehow we must decent prices paid to the producers of British milk, irrespective of the cost to the consumer. If supermarkets choose to use it as a lost leader, that is their choice. Their profits could stand it. I am sure if a survey were down, most people would not know the price of supermarket milk. They buy of necessity. 

This pricing thing needs sorting - NOW.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
